title: Everything you need to know about Oregon-Penn State, Bama-Georgia and a blockbuster Week 5
content: This weekend features the deepest schedule of the college football season -- and Bill Connelly is here for it all.

title: Lynx's Reeve blasts refs after Collier hurt in loss
content: Ejected late in Game 3, Lynx coach Cheryl Reeve was critical of the officials, saying it was "malpractice" to have them work a semifinal playoff game.

title: Virginia stuns No. 8 FSU in 2OT as fans storm field
content: Virginia held on for a 46-38 double-overtime win over No. 8 Florida State, leading to a chaotic postgame scene in which fans rushed the field.

title: Sources: Bucs' Mayfield, Godwin expected to play
content: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield, wide receiver Chris Godwin and left tackle Tristan Wirfs are expected to play against the Eagles, sources told ESPN.

title: Reds tie Mets for NL's 3rd and final wild-card spot
content: The Reds have put themselves in position to earn their first playoff berth since the pandemic-shortened 2020 season while keeping the free-spending Mets out of the postseason.

title: Goodell: Teams embracing NFL's global push
content: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell says teams have embraced the global expansion of the sport, and he reiterated his goal to play 16 international games per season.

title: Rafaela's walk-off triple sends Red Sox to playoffs
content: Ceddanne Rafaela tripled to drive in the game-winning run in the ninth inning, giving the Red Sox a 4-3 victory over the Tigers and clinching Boston's first postseason berth since 2021.

title: West Ham confirms Nuno hire after Potter firing
content: Graham Potter has been fired by West Ham after a dismal start to the season, and sources have told ESPN that Nuno Espirito Santo will replace him.

title: NFL HQ building shooter diagnosed with CTE
content: Shane Tamura, who killed four people and then himself in a July shooting at the building that houses the NFL's headquarters, was posthumously diagnosed with CTE, according to a statement from the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

title: Ryder Cup 2025: Best moments from Day 2
content: Europe has a three-point lead after the first day of the Ryder Cup. Can the U.S. mount a comeback at Bethpage Black?

title: Everything left to play for during MLB's final weekend
content: There's still a lot at stake entering the final weekend of the regular season. We have your guide to the last few days of baseball before October.

title: Our experts' final say on NFL Week 4: Key trends, fantasy sleepers and bold predictions
content: Big days for two Bears receivers? Sack opportunities for the Texans' pass rush? Upside for Geno Smith? Catch up on Week 4 prep.

title: College football best bets for Week 5: Why UK matches up well with South Carolina
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 5 of the college football season, including what to expect when Kentucky heads to South Carolina.

title: Penn State RBs Nicholas Singleton and Kaytron Allen doing record things
content: Despite scouts placing the pair in the first two days of the NFL draft, they returned for one more year.

title: 'Our tradition to is to be untraditional': Inside the lifecycle of an Oregon uniform
content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Reyes halt Ulberg's winning streak at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night from Perth, Australia? MMA analysts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: From The Big Dumper to ... magic? Why Mariners might have the mojo to finally win it all
content: Seattle has never won a World Series. Or even an American League pennant. Could a little bit of magic change that?

title: üèà How Campbell's 'kneecap speech' changed the NFL
content: Campbell was mocked for his introductory presser with the Lions. But players, execs and fans loved it -- and knew they had their guy.

title: ‚úç Regular-season grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: Whether your team is headed to October or packing its bags for the offseason, how did 2025 measure up to expectations?

title: üèÄ Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn
content: Bruce Pearl has stepped down as the men's hoops coach at Auburn and will move into an ambassador's role in the athletic department as special assistant to the athletics director, the school announced Monday.

title: üèà Oklahoma St. fires longtime coach Mike Gundy
content: Oklahoma State, which has lost 11 of 12 games since the start of the 2024 season, has fired head coach Mike Gundy, who was in his 21st season with the Cowboys.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent NFL trades
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: 'This season he is better than ever': Haaland is becoming the complete striker for Man City
content: The goals are still flowing for Erling Haaland, but his growth as a leader and an all-around contributor has made him invaluable to Pep Guardiola and Manchester City.

title: Liverpool's Chiesa is 'here to win' and now has the chance to prove it
content: Federico Chiesa has struggled at times after moving to Liverpool, but he has a chance to reignite his career.

title: Micah Parsons' hobby? Beating Packers teammates at HORSE, pingpong and bowling
content: "We just building relationships," Parsons said of competing with his new teammates ahead of Sunday's return to Dallas.

title: Inside the Gundy-Oklahoma State divorce
content: After 20 years together, Gundy and the Pokes split. It was the culmination of a great run and internal strife.

title: Ranking boxing fights: Fundora-Thurman, Parker-Wardley, more
content: From Sebastian Fundora's title bout, to the junior middleweight debut of "Boots" Ennis, ESPN picks October's best fights.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Man United eye cut-priced Vlahovic
content: Chelsea and Manchester United will try to sign Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Mercury take 2-1 lead over Lynx, Aces up 2-1 over Fever
content: In the 2025 WNBA semifinals, Phoenix leads 1-seed Minnesota 2-1 while Las Vegas is up 2-1 over Indiana.

title: Arizona State, West Virginia lead best uniforms from college football Week 5
content: Arizona State is going with all-black threads for its Friday night showdown, while West Virginia will don a look that throws things back all the way to 1965.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Canada wooes US H-1B holders: PM Carney says he will soon roll out an offer
content: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney announced plans to attract skilled foreign workers, particularly those to be impacted by the US's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee. Recognizing these individuals as enterprising, Canada aims to capitalize on this opportunity. Indians already form Canada's largest immigrant group, with thousands becoming permanent residents and citizens annually.

title: 'Won war? Enjoy destroyed runways and burnt-out hangars': India mocks Pak at UN
content: India sharply rebuked Pakistan at the UN, dismissing its victory claims in a recent war and demanding an end to terror sponsorship. New Delhi reminded the UN of Pakistan's history of sheltering terrorists like Osama bin Laden and its role in attacks, asserting accountability for both terrorists and their patrons, while rejecting third-party mediation.

title: Harjit Kaur deported: Sikh woman gives harrowing details of ordeal; slept on floor
content: Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old Sikh woman, detailed her distressing deportation from the US after three decades, alleging severe mistreatment by ICE, including being denied a bed despite double knee replacements. Her unsuccessful appeals preceded her repatriation.

title: Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
content: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: Asia Cup Final | 'Will be aggressive': Pakistan captain Agha fires bold warning to India
content: Pakistan captain Salman Agha has issued a strong warning to Team India ahead of the historic Asia Cup 2025 final in Dubai, marking the first-ever India-Pakistan title clash. Agha declared Pakistan will maintain an aggressive mindset, giving his players a free hand and full backing for their decisions in the crucial match.

title: Asia Cup Final | 'Dismiss Shubman and Abhishek early': Akram's bold message to Pak
content: Pakistan legend Wasim Akram has tipped India as favourites for the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan, urging Salman Agha‚Äôs men to carry their Super 4 momentum. Akram believes early wickets, particularly of Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma, could test India's middle order in the historic first-ever India-Pakistan Asia Cup summit clash.

title: Billionaire Silicon Valley investor says US' H-1B visa policy could backfire
content: Michael Moritz, a prominent Silicon Valley investor, has strongly condemned President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it will stifle innovation and drive talent overseas. He believes the policy reflects a misunderstanding of the factors driving American tech success. Moritz suggests expanding the H-1B program and offering citizenship to STEM PhD graduates instead.

title: Durga pandal row: BJP slams Mamata for 'Kaaba in my heart' song - watch
content: The BJP criticized West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee after a video showed her clapping to a song 'Kaaba in my heart' sung by a TMC MLA at a Durga Pandal. BJP leaders called it appeasement politics and an attack on Hinduism, questioning the appropriateness of the song during Navratri. They warned of trampling Sanatan Dharma for radical votes.

title: Asia Cup | IND vs PAK: Abhishek on cusp of breaking Rohit, Kohli, and Rizwan records
content: Indian opener Abhishek Sharma is on the verge of shattering T20I records held by Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Mohammed Rizwan as India prepares for the Asia Cup final. With 309 runs in the tournament, he needs just 11 more to surpass Kohli's record and 23 to break Phil Salt's. He has also equaled a record for consecutive 30-plus scores.

title: Top H‚Äë1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others; check list
content: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.

title: Happy Daughter's Day: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes to share with your daughter
content: Daughter's Day will be celebrated on September 28, 2025. This day reminds parents to cherish their daughters. The article offers various wishes and messages. These include heartfelt, funny, and inspirational options. Parents can use these to express love and pride. Social media messages and timeless quotes are also provided. Celebrate your daughters and make lasting memories.

title: Longevity doctor says cholesterol is misunderstood ‚Äî here‚Äôs the truth
content: Dr. Jonathan Schoeff posits that cholesterol is essential for brain function, hormone production, and bodily repair, challenging its perception as solely detrimental. He argues that overly aggressive cholesterol reduction may undermine health, emphasizing that LDL subtypes and context are more critical than total levels. Emerging evidence supports this nuanced perspective on cholesterol's role.

title: 'He stayed the same': Gisele B√ºndchen reveals why she left Leonardo DiCaprio
content: Gisele Bundchen, post-divorce from Tom Brady, reflects on her past high-profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio, revealing it ended due to differing life paths. She also recalls meeting Brady, whom she married in 2009 before their 2022 divorce. Bundchen now lives a comfortable life with her new boyfriend, Joaquim Valente.

title: 'Vote revdi': Congress slams PM Modi over scheme for Bihar women
content: The Congress criticized Prime Minister Modi's new scheme providing Rs 10,000 to 75 lakh women in poll-bound Bihar, labeling it "vote revdi" and "vote chori." Congress leader Jairam Ramesh accused Modi of hypocrisy, highlighting his previous criticism of Karnataka's similar welfare scheme while now implementing one himself just before elections.

title: Chia deeds with curd: Why it is the ultimate breakfast recommended by experts
content: Busy mornings often lead to skipped breakfasts, but experts suggest overnight solutions like chia seeds with curd and berries. These tiny seeds, packed with protein, fiber, and omega-3s, offer immense health benefits from improved digestion to stable blood sugar.

title: Asia Cup: 'How much time?' PCB chief drops cryptic post ahead of IND vs PAK final
content: PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi posted a cryptic social media message. This sparked controversy before the Asia Cup final. India's Suryakumar Yadav faced an ICC fine. Pakistan's Haris Rauf also received a penalty. Naqvi offered to pay Rauf's fine. He shared a Ronaldo video resembling Rauf's gesture. Off-field issues now overshadow the final match.

title: Mid-air panic: Passenger held at Mumbai airport for smoking on flight from Phuket
content: A 25-year-old passenger, Bhavya Gautam Jain, was arrested at Mumbai airport for allegedly smoking in a flight lavatory during a Phuket-Mumbai flight on Friday night. The incident caused panic among passengers, leading to Jain's booking under the Aircraft Act, as smoking is strictly prohibited on all flights.

title: 'Swadeshi' 4G: PM Modi launches BSNL service; India joins select group of nations
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated projects worth over Rs 60,000 crore in Odisha. BSNL's indigenous 4G network launched, a major telecom milestone. Over 97,500 4G towers were commissioned across multiple states. Two semiconductor units received approval for Odisha. Railway, healthcare, and education sectors also saw new initiatives. The government highlighted its vision for self-reliance.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row: What sparked violent protests in UP‚Äôs Bareilly? 10 things to know
content: Protests over "I Love Muhammad" posters turned violent in Uttar Pradesh. Bareilly witnessed stone-pelting and vehicle vandalism after Friday prayers. Police used lathi charge and tear gas to disperse crowds. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered strict action against miscreants. Religious and political leaders appealed for calm. The unrest spread to several other states. Authorities ensured heightened security for upcoming festivals.

title: IND vs PAK: Massive! Rajeev Shukla predicts result of Asia Cup final
content: BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla is highly optimistic about India winning the T20 Asia Cup 2025, as the undefeated team prepares for a historic final against Pakistan on September 28. India has showcased brilliant form, with Abhishek Sharma emerging as the top batter and Kuldeep Yadav leading the wicket-takers, including two decisive victories over Pakistan.

title: 'Left no chance to loot people': PM Modi attacks Congress in Odisha
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a public meeting in Odisha, accused the Congress of looting people and taxing low-income groups, contrasting it with BJP's relief efforts like raising income tax limits and reducing GST. He launched development projects worth over Rs 60,000 crore, emphasising Odisha's progress under a 'double-engine' government and the 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' vision.

title: New Spin bowling coach! Former India player to take charge at BCCI CoE: When?
content: Former India spinner Sunil Joshi is appointed as the new spin bowling coach at the BCCI Centre of Excellence, effective October 1. Bringing extensive coaching experience, he will collaborate with CoE Head VVS Laxman to identify, nurture, and groom spin talent across all age groups, including current Indian team members, replacing Sairaj Bahutale.

title: Delhi BMW accident case: Accused Gaganpreet Kaur gets bail; court flays paramedics at scene
content: Delhi's Patiala court granted bail to Gaganpreet Kaur in the BMW accident case that tragically killed a finance ministry official. However, the court sharply questioned an ambulance's conduct, which arrived at the scene but left within 30 seconds without transporting the injured. It asked if this constituted medical negligence, highlighting the ambulance's duty to assist accident victims.

title: 'Voting for DMK is voting for BJP': Vijay accuses parties of having underground dealings
content: TVK chief Vijay campaigned in Namakkal, accusing DMK of secret dealings with BJP and vowing to face them in 2026. He promised stringent measures against kidney theft, linking it to a DMK MLA's hospital and the government's failure to uplift weavers, whose plight drives such heinous acts.

title: 'Lasted for hours': Denmark reports new drone sightings over biggest military base
content: Danish police confirmed fresh drone sightings over Karup Airbase, Denmark's largest military base, marking the latest in a series of aerial intrusions. These incidents, which have also affected other critical infrastructure, are being investigated as a possible "hybrid attack" on the country. Authorities are treating the situation with caution amid rising regional tensions.

title: 'Pakistan link being probed': Ladakh DGP explains why Sonam Wangchuk was held
content: Ladakh DGP briefed on the September 24 violence, where 17 CRPF personnel and over 70 civilians were injured during protests. He accused environmental activist Sonam Wangchuk of sabotaging ongoing government discussions with local bodies regarding 6th Schedule status and statehood, leading to the violent clashes and property damage.

title: World Championships: Historic! 18-year-old Sheetal Devi clinches gold
content: Sheetal Devi, an 18-year-old armless Indian archer, made history by winning gold in the women's compound individual category at the Para World Archery Championship, defeating world No.1 Oznur Cure Girdi. This marked her third medal, adding to a mixed team bronze and a women's open team silver, showcasing her unique technique using feet and chin.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row: UP cleric Tauqeer Raza Khan detained after protest turns violent
content: Police detained Tauqeer Raza Khan, chief of Ittehad-e-Millat Council, after a violent clash erupted in Bareilly following his call for an 'I Love Muhammad' protest. Authorities cited a planned conspiracy and Section 163 BNSS, while Raza claimed house arrest and police atrocities. The controversy stems from an FIR against displaying 'I Love Muhammad' boards, sparking wider protests and national debate.

title: Deadly clash in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: 17 killed in Pakistan-TTP gunfight
content: Seventeen Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) militants were killed in a joint operation by security forces in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa's Karak district after they opened fire, injuring three personnel. A curfew was imposed for further operations. Separately, an airstrike reportedly killed 23 civilians, including women and children, in the same province, though no official statement has been issued.

title: 'Proliferation of trade-restrictive actions': Brics declaration slams Trump tariffs
content: BRICS foreign ministers condemned Trump-era US tariffs as trade-restrictive actions disrupting global supply chains and economic stability. Meeting on the sidelines of UNGA80, the expanded group, including new members, also pushed for reforms in global institutions like the UN Security Council and greater representation for developing nations, underscoring their growing influence.

title: ‚ÄòLike any other customer‚Äô: Rahul Gandhi grabs a slice at Gurgaon pizzeria
content: Rahul Gandhi made a surprise stopover at a Gurgaon pizzeria on Tuesday night, accompanied by two friends. Sporting a peach T-shirt, he behaved like any other customer, waiting patiently and enjoying salad, pizza, and Coke for 45 minutes. He interacted with staff and customers, obliging selfies, and briefly discussed election results with a party spokesperson.

title: 'Hum dhund rahe Sharma ji': Cameraman shows Tilak Varma as opener
content: India secured a thrilling Super Over victory against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2025 Super Fours clash in Dubai. After India posted 202/5, Sri Lanka, led by Pathum Nissanka's century, tied the game. Arshdeep's tight bowling in the Super Over sealed India's dramatic win, propelling them to the final.

title: Where does power lie in Pakistan? Khawaja Asif admits to 'Hybrid Model'
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif defended the nation's "hybrid model" of governance, asserting military and civilian leadership operate "by consensus." He dismissed claims of army dominance, attributing such perceptions to past military rulers, while controversially labeling US democracy a "deep state." Asif maintained this arrangement, though not ideal, is a "practical necessity" for managing Pakistan's crises, despite critics branding it undemocratic.

title: MP: 4-year-old hacked to death in front of mother; assailant dies after mob attack
content: A four-year-old boy was brutally killed in Indore's Aali village. A 24-year-old man attacked the child with a sharp weapon. The boy's mother was also injured while trying to intervene. Villagers confronted the assailant, who was then tied up and assaulted. Police took him to the hospital where he later died. A judicial probe has been ordered into his death.

title: 'Paagal ho gaya hai kya?': Rinku Singh's hilarious dig at Arshdeep Singh goes viral
content: Indian cricketers Rinku Singh, Arshdeep Singh, and Jitesh Sharma shared a fun moment after India's Super Over win against Sri Lanka. Rinku playfully teased Arshdeep about his match-winning two wickets in the Super Over, recreating a viral reel. India, now clear favourites, will face Pakistan in the Asia Cup final.

title: IMD predicts heavy rain in Mumbai, suburbs; orange alert issued
content: The India Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert for Mumbai and its suburbs, predicting heavy to very heavy rainfall on Saturday. Residents woke to overcast skies and light showers, with a high tide expected in the afternoon. While city traffic remains normal, local train services are experiencing some delays due to the weather.

title: ‚ÄòForced to speak Hindi‚Äô: Kerala students assaulted near Red Fort
content: CPI(M) MP John Brittas has urged Delhi Police to investigate the alleged assault of two Kerala students near Red Fort. The students were reportedly beaten, stripped, and humiliated by police and locals after being falsely accused of theft. They were mocked for their traditional attire and limited Hindi, prompting Brittas to call for justice and cultural sensitivity from the force.

title: 30 years a slave: Abducted as 7-yr-old, Ahmedabad man returns to find home
content: A 7-year-old boy, kidnapped from Ahmedabad over three decades ago, reappeared at 35 after escaping bonded labor in Haryana. Forced to work on an animal farm, he clung to fragmented memories of his family. Now, police are assisting the man, identified as 'Raju', in his challenging quest to reunite with his long-lost relatives.

title: J&K: BSF IG says 'there is presence of terrorists on LoC launch pads'
content: Terrorists are positioned at Line of Control launch pads, actively seeking to infiltrate Kashmir before the onset of winter, a senior BSF officer confirmed. Security forces remain highly alert and fully prepared to thwart these attempts, which typically increase ahead of snowfall. Two infiltration bids have already been foiled this year due to tight security and modern surveillance.

title: Asia Cup: R Ashwin lambasts Harshit Rana's performance against Sri Lanka
content: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin slammed pacer Harshit Rana's "amateurish" bowling after India's tense Super 4s clash against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2025. Harshit conceded 54 runs, struggling with predictable deliveries, but dismissed centurion Pathum Nissanka in the final over, forcing a Super Over that India ultimately won.

title: 'They didn‚Äôt want a black character': Gabrielle Union on film rejection
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.

title: 10 die after crowd surge at TVK president Vijay‚Äôs rally in Karur
content: Several people reportedly fainted in the rush and were rushed to the Karur Medical College Hospital and private hospitals nearby

title: Health Minister inaugurates mother and child hospital constructed at a cost of ‚Çπ15 crore in Sindhanur
content: Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao has said that the State government aims to ensure good health service to the people of Raichur district and to achieve that a mother and child hospital is now open and another 16 healthcare centres will soon be set up in the district

title: Speaker adjourns Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly sine die
content: House conducts business for 46 hours, approves 23 Bills; Amenities Committee, headed by the Speaker, places a report requesting the government to restructure the pay and allowances of members

title: Students, MLAs urge ICAR to include agri school students in B.Sc. Agriculture admissions
content: ICAR chief says seven universities agree to review norms after complaints over exclusion despite CUET clearance

title: Watch: India‚Äôs diamond hub battles tariff hock, seeks government rescue | Pulse Maharashtra
content: In this week‚Äôs Pulse Maharashtra, Vinaya Deshpande Pandit reports on the growing crisis faced by thousands of artisans in Mumbai‚Äôs SEEPZ and Surat‚Äôs diamond polishing industry. With U.S. tariffs on gems and jewellery soaring to 50%, exports are stalling, risking billions in trade and nearly a million jobs. Industry leaders are urging the government for relief as workers brace for uncertain times ahead.

title: TVK Vijay rally LIVE updates: At least 10 dead after crowd surge in Karur
content: TVK chief Vijay abruptly ends speech at heavily overcrowded rally in Karur, several people in crowd faint; taken away in ambulances

title: Bhadrachalam ITDA receives Tourism Excellence Award-2025
content: The ITDA received the Tourism Excellence Award in recognition of its efforts in showcasing the exhibits at the Tribal Museum thematically and preserving the rich cultural heritage of tribal people for posterity, ITDA sources said

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu announces launch of ‚ÄòAuto Drivers‚Äô Sevalo‚Äô on October 4
content: Under the scheme, eligible auto and cab drivers will be provided a financial assistance of ‚Çπ15,000 annually, the Chief Minister informs the Legislative Assembly, and asserts the double-engine government‚Äôs commitment to fulfil promises made in the manifesto

title: From tea factory to school: Munnar Government Vocational Higher Secondary School celebrates 100th year anniversary
content: The school was set up by Britishers in an old tea factory as a high school in 1926. The government took over the institution in 1955 and later upgraded it to a vocational higher secondary school

title: 17 remote villages of Chamarajanagar brought under 4G telecom network
content: ‚ÄòAuthorities have identified about 22 ‚Äònetwork shadow‚Äô villages in the district without any telecom services. Out of them, 17 have now been covered under the BSNL‚Äôs 4G Saturation Project, while work is under way to provide connectivity to the remaining five villages,‚Äô says Shilpa Nag

title: State school arts festival in Thrissur will be a grand success, says Sivankutty¬†
content: Over 14,000 students from across the State will compete in 249 events across 26 venues from January 7 to January 11

title: 30 projects, 50,000 jobs: Telangana launches ambitious tourism plan
content: Minister for Tourism Jupally Krishna Rao said among the proposed projects 14 will be developed under the public-private partnership with an outlay of ‚Çπ7,081 crore, while 16 will be taken up by the private sector with ‚Çπ8,198 crore in funding

title: Schedule for final phase of PG admissions in A.P. released
content: The process will begin on September 29, while candidates can pay their registration and processing fees for web counselling by October 4

title: Plea before Delhi High Court seeks quashing of FIRs over ‚ÄòI Love Muhammad‚Äô posters
content: Petition says cases target peaceful religious expression of minority community and threaten communal harmony

title: ‚ÄòPoshan Maah‚Äô  initiative  on reducing obesity
content: WCD to create awareness of reducing consumption of sugar and oil against backdrop of increase in childhood obesity

title: SARAS exhibition to open in Vizianagaram on September 28, runs until October 8
content: Artisans from across the country will offer quality products at reasonable prices at the expo, says Collector

title: Veeyapuram rows to victory at Thazhathangadi Boat Race
content: Melppadam Chundan of Pallathuruthy Boat Club came second, while Nadubhagam Chundan of Punnamada Boat Club finished third in the Kottayam leg of the Champions Boat League

title: Rookie Watch: Demidov and 11 other names you need to know this season
content: Whether in a redraft or dynasty league, here are the rookies you need to know before your fantasy hockey draft.

title: Karnataka records sharp decline in child marriages in three years: Study
content: Unlike most other states, Karnataka relied more on helplines and Child Welfare Committees than police stations (40%) for reporting cases

title: Ensure 100% registration of pregnant women in PHCs across Chittoor, says Collector
content: Sumit Kumar urges medical and paramedical staff at the field level to continuously maintain follow-up of high-risk and teenage pregnancies until delivery

title: World Tourism Day celebrated in Mysuru; stakeholders for greater promotion of tourism sector
content: Mysuru tourism was largely fueled by domestic tourists but bulk of visitors from Bengaluru tend to do follow the ‚Äòsame-day return‚Äô policy as one can easily travel from Mysuru to Bengaluru in less than two hours at night

title: Two police personnel confess to extortion in Bengaluru‚Äôs Whitefield
content: Victim is a native of West Bengal and working as school van driver , accused him as Bangladesh national and detained him as on the charges of illegal immigration.

title: Congress appears ‚Äòunperturbed‚Äô by NSS‚Äôs ‚Äòqualified support‚Äô for LDF‚Äôs Sabarimala policy
content: Recently, AICC general secretary K.C. Venugopal underscored the need to reach out to the NSS by stating that the ‚Äúparty will rectify miscommunication if any‚Äù. CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan on Friday claimed that the Congress‚Äôs ‚Äúmisplaced belief‚Äù that Hindu social organisations were perennially opposed to the LDF lay in tatters, given their support for the LDF‚Äôs Devaswom policy.

title: BSP becomes the first party to announce candidates for upcoming Bihar election
content: The party has announced candidates for three of the four constituencies of Kaimur district ‚Äì Bhabua, Mohania and Ramgarh.

title: HDMC¬†proposes to raise ‚Çπ100 crore through bonds; committee to be formed to study the proposal
content: The Hubballi Dharwad Municipal Corporation is contemplating on raising ‚Çπ 100 crores through Green and Climate Bonds and a committee will be formed to study the pros and cons of the proposal.

title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Council adjourns sine die without passing Bill on job for political violence victim‚Äôs son
content: The Opposition contends that offering government jobs in cases of political murders will set a wrong precedent

title: African Swine Fever: pigs culled in two farms in Thrissur
content: Strict restrictions have been imposed on the sale of pork, operation of meat shops, and transportation of pigs outside the district

title: Kalpavriksha Vahanam enchants devotees at Tirumala on fourth day of annual Brahmotsavams
content: Thousands of devotees throng Tirumala as Lord Malayappa, accompanied by his consorts, blesses the crowds during the festival. The day also sees the ceremonial arrival of garlands from Srivilliputtur and the presentation of umbrellas for the upcoming Garuda Seva

title: Ballari officials directed to expedite Social and Educational Survey work
content: Ballari Deputy Commissioner K. Nagendra Prasad has issued strict instructions to officials and enumerators to ensure speedy completion of the ongoing Social and Educational Survey in the district

title: CM promises to complete works on CIAL-funded bridges in 18 months
content: The bridges are being built under the ‚ÄòOperation Pravah‚Äô project, which aims to protect the areas surrounding the airport from flood threats

title: Call for reducing canine rabies through IBCM approach
content: On this World Rabies Day, there is a growing consensus that reducing canine rabies through integrated approach, emphasising community involvement, surveillance, and mass dog vaccination for elimination is more cost-effective approach.

title: Tamil Nadu is emerging as a pioneering State in agriculture, says Chief Minister Stalin
content: Through every scheme, the DMK government is not only striving to improve¬†agriculture but also enhance the living standards of farmers, he says at the inaugural event of ‚ÄòAgri-Business Festival 2025‚Äô

title: ‚Çπ14 crore worth proposals to boost tourism in Kurnool, says Collector
content: A. Siri urges people to protect heritage sites, maintain cleanliness at the tourism centres, cut down reliance on plastic and avoid excessive power consumption

title: Two months after SC held mental health as a part of right to life, IIT student seeks court‚Äôs help to access affordable medical care
content: In the July verdict, the court had highlighted ‚Äòan emerging pattern of distress in educational institutions, coaching centres, and residential educational institutions which point to a systemic failure in addressing students‚Äô emotional and mental health needs‚Äô

title: Nitish Kumar unfit to govern, Bihar needs rapid development: Tejashwi Yadav
content: RJD leader targets Chief Minister‚Äôs age and health, promises welfare schemes for extremely backward classes ahead of Bihar Assembly elections

title: Heritage tonga ride showcases Mysuru‚Äôs landmark monuments
content: The reason the horse-drawn carriages were used for the heritage ride was that Mysuru was known for tongas till the 1970s and were gradually supplanted by motorised vehicles

title: NDA will win more than 160 seats in Bihar, says Amit Shah
content: For RJD chief Lalu Prasad, Mr. Shah says this election is all about ensuring his son Tejashwi Yadav becomes the Chief Minister but for BJP, the campaign is focused on driving out ‚Äòinfiltrators‚Äô from Bihar and not letting ‚Äòjungle raj‚Äô return

title: Priyank Kharge visits more flood-affected villages in Kalaburagi, promises relief measures
content: Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister and Kalaburagi district in charge Priyank Kharge continued his visits to flood-affected villages in Chittapur and Kalagi taluks on Saturday, assessing the damage caused by incessant rainfall and overflowing streams and rivers in the district and interacting with affected residents

title: Potluri Bhaskara Rao re-elected AP Chambers president
content: The trade body elects new office-bearers for 2025-27, vows to act as a bridge between industry and government, empower entrepreneurs, and drive inclusive development

title: Students boycott classes across four districts in Karnataka seeking appointment of guest lecturers
content: Students of government degree colleges in Kalaburagi, Ballari, Vijayanagara, and Koppal boycotted classes on Saturday in response to a call by the All India Democratic Students‚Äô Organisation

title: PM Modi indulging in ‚Äòvote revdi‚Äô along with ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô: Congress dig on ‚Çπ10,000 to Bihar women
content: Jairam Ramesh said PM Modi was criticising the Congress government in Karnataka for providing ‚Çπ2,000 per month to 1.3 crore women under the Griha Lakshmi scheme, but is now himself doing it

title: A.P. Legislative Council clears key university Bills
content: The government has allocated 55 acres for an international law university in Amaravati, reserving 25% of seats for students from the State, says HRD Minister

title: Vote us out in 2026 if we cannot ensure justice for Zubeen Garg: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: The Chief Minister appealed to the late singer-composer‚Äôs agitated fans to not turn Assam into Nepal by venting their anger on the streets

title: Police crushing dissent, curbing free speech in Andhra Pradesh, alleges YSRCP chief Jagan¬†
content: He welcomes the High Court‚Äôs suo motu direction to hand over to the CBI the case pertaining to the arrest of the party‚Äôs social media activist Savindra Reddy

title: Energy Management Centre director to study feasibility of tapping Kerala‚Äôs thorium deposits
content: The director is expected to visit Kalpakkam in Tamil Nadu, where India‚Äôs first indigenous fast breeder reactor is under development, later this year

title: Children Among 10 Dead In Stampede-Like Situation At Vijay's Rally: Official
content: Three children and seven adults were killed in a stampede-like situation during actor-politician Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur today, officials at a local hospital said.

title: Putin Praises PM Modi's 'Independent' Policy, India's 'Highest' Economic Growth Rates
content: "Under leadership of PM Modi, India is pursuing a completely independent, sovereign policy and, most importantly, is achieving very good results in the economic sphere. India is demonstrating the highest economic growth rates," Russian President said

title: Watch: Diplomat Who Ripped Apart Pak At UN Sings In French, Plays Guitar
content: Indian diplomat Petal Gahlot, who demolished terror-sponsor Pakistan's narrative at the UN General Assembly, is also an avid guitarist.

title: Taj Mahal Most-Visited Ticketed Monument In 2024-25, Drawing 6.9 Million Tourists
content: Mughal-era mausoleum Taj Mahal in Agra was the most-visited centrally protected ticketed monument for both domestic and foreign tourists in the financial year 2024-25, according to data published in a compendium released by the government on Saturday

title: Election Body To Visit Bihar On October 4-5 To Review Poll Preparedness
content: The Election Commission, led by CEC Gyanesh Kumar, will visit Patna on October 4 and 5 to take stock of poll preparedness in Bihar, officials said on Saturday.

title: Couple Dies By Suicide In Madhya Pradesh, Leaves Behind Infant Son On Roadside
content: In a disturbing incident that has shaken the Betul district of Madhya Pradesh, a young couple reportedly ended their lives by jumping into the Buka Khedi dam, leaving behind their one-and-a-half-year-old son on the roadside.

title: Pratibha Patil's Family Accuses Maharashtra Minister Of Seizing 33 Acres Of Ancestral Land
content: Family of former President Pratibha Patil on Saturday levelled serious allegations against Maharashtra Minister Jaykumar Rawal, accusing him and his associates of illegally seizing their ancestral land in Shirpur taluka of Dhule district.

title: "Satyamev Jayate": Sameer Wankhede On 'Ba***ds Of Bollywood' Defamation Case
content: Former Mumbai zonal director at Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) Sameer Wankhede on Saturday avoided a direct response to questions linked to the 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' series and said he would not answer on these issues.

title: West Bengal Man Arrested For Threatening Kapil Sharma, Demanding Rs 1 Crore
content: A West Bengal resident has been arrested for allegedly threatening comedian Kapil Sharma using the names of gangsters Rohit Godara and Goldy Brar and demanding Rs 1 crore, police said in Mumbai on Saturday.

title: PM Modi Unveils Developmental Projects Worth Over Rs 50,000 Crore In Odisha
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday laid the foundation stone and inaugurated development projects worth over Rs 50,000 crore across telecommunications, railways, higher education, healthcare, skill development and rural housing sectors.

title: Who Is Petal Gahlot, Indian Diplomat Who Gave Sharp Response To Pakistan PM At UN
content: Indian diplomat Petal Gahlot delivered a sharp response to Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif at the UN.

title: Heart Disease Claims 8 Lives Every Minute In South-East Asia: WHO
content: Heart diseases are the leading cause of deaths in South-East Asia, with the condition claiming the lives of eight people every minute, said the World Health Organization (WHO) on Saturday, ahead of World Heart Day.

title: India Hosts SCO Young Authors Meet On Cultural Bonds In Digital Age
content: The Ministry of Education, in partnership with the Ministry of External Affairs, organised the 2nd Biennial SCO (Shanghai Cooperation Organisation) Young Authors' Conference in New Delhi from September 25 to 26.

title: Viksit Bharat 2047: How Adani Cement Is Bridging Schools And Industry
content: Adani Cement is taking a big step towards India's vision of Viksit Bharat 2047 by actively linking education with industry through its FutureX initiative.

title: Weather Agency Predicts Rainfall During 5-Day Durga Puja Festival In West Bengal
content: Durga Puja festivities may get somewhat dampened as a new low pressure area likely to form over the Bay of Bengal on October 1 would bring rain in many areas during next seven days with downpour at isolated places in some districts of south Bengal

title: Tuticorin To Rival Singapore As Global Transhipment Hub: Minister To NDTV
content: The Tuticorin Outer Harbour in Tamil Nadu is being developed into a world-class transhipment hub, Union Shipping Minister Sarbananda Sonowal told NDTV.

title: 'Highly Unhygienic': Allahabad High Court Orders Registry To Reject Files With Paan Saliva Stains
content: The Allahabad High Court has expressed serious concern over some registry staff indulging in the "highly unhygienic" practice of using saliva - particularly when chewing paan or paan masala - to turn pages in court files, leaving reddish stains

title: Hiroshima Survivors Honor PM Modi For World Peace Advocacy, 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam' Philosophy
content: Hiroshima atomic bomb survivors on Saturday lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his advocacy of world peace and his philosophy of 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam', honouring him with a citation by the Japanese NGO 'Peace Culture Village'.

title: Google Turns 27: This Is How Its Bengaluru Office Celebrated The Day
content: Google's Bengaluru office celebrated the company's 27th birthday with a lively party, complete with food, cake and festive cheer.

title: UAE Meets Netanyahu, Skips Mass Walkout In UN During His Speech As Gaza Burns
content: While Arab outrage against Israel's Gaza offensive echoed loudly at the UN General Assembly, the UAE took a starkly different route - one that's drawing sharp criticism.
